cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi (380 km) east of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly drifting north-northeast through early Saturday, then turning north and eventually west toward the north-west Gulf coast, aiming for the central-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to upper Texas coast, roughly between Matagorda Bay and Freeport

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northern Mexico to Louisiana, including the entire Texas shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible with a 29% cumulative chance (peak probability around Tuesday). Gusty conditions could exceed 40 mph near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-period swells and building seas reaching the upper Texas coast this weekend, with potential storm surge exceeding 3 ft during the early-week approach/landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement may produce prolonged heavy rain bands capable of 4â€“8 inches near Galveston with isolated higher totals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas affecting vessel traffic and port operations beginning this weekend.
